page.title: 08ECOLOGY STRACATHRO
page.content:
KEVIN WRITES:
If you take a walk round our school you may hear lawn-mowers buzzing or combine-harvesters rumbling in the barley and wheat fields. You may hear the putt-putt of helicopters flying to the near-by hospital or to the U.S.Navy Base at Edzell. If you stand and listen by the West Water Bridge you may hear the plop of a salmon or the swish of a brown-trout jumping for a midge on a summer evening. At half-past three you will hear the happy shouts of children spilling from the little school and the s-s-s of rubber-tyres as bikes and cars take them home after a hard day's work.
